thread.section_title: The Wall Street Journal & Breaking News, Business, Financial and Economic News, World News and Video
thread.title: Trump Administration Looks Into New Tariffs on Imported Vehicles

author: William Mauldin
title: Trump Administration Looks Into New Tariffs on Imported Vehicles

organizations.name: trump administration looks into new tariffs

text:
WASHINGTON—The Trump administration is using national-security laws to consider imposing new tariffs on vehicle and auto-parts imports, the Commerce Department said Wednesday.
President Donald Trump is asking for new tariffs of as much as 25% on automobile imports, according to those familiar with his request, after he repeatedly signaled his intention to impose such tariffs.
Mr.... RELATED VIDEO Two Trade Rules That Are Complicating Nafta Talks Negotiators from the U.S., Canada and Mexico are scrambling to reach a Nafta deal by July, but two proposals involving autos are complicating the talks. WSJ’s Shelby Holliday explains.
